data.title: Watching task keeps on spinning if isBackground is not specified
data.body:
Refs #23277

1. Generate a new vscode extension using yo generator
2. Open `tasks.json` and add a `"isBackground": false` to the `npm` task
3. Run task npm -> it the status bar always shows the spinner and it never completes

I would expect a more gracefull way of handling watching tasks.
This is particularly noticable if this task is a preLaunchTask so debugging does not start since the task is never finished

data.title: Updating Visual Studio code should retain last opened files
data.body:
Whenever i install a newer version of Visual Studio code, it updates fine but it cannot retain list of files that it opened lastly. I guess this was given in last build & removed now.  Even in the last build, it was able to retain only one file among many files. This needs to be fixed.

data.title: EOL is not set when applying from DocumentFormattingEditProvider
vscode.TextEdit.setEndOfLine is removing the complete content in the file
Consider to flag keybinding conflicts
data.body:
testing #23287:

When assigning the same keybinding to different commands, this might result in conflicts (and I have no idea which command gets executed).

I suggest to show a warning next to the keybinding when conflicts exist.

macOS does this too:
![2017-03-28_13-22-52](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/24403262/5b7fd3d4-13bc-11e7-90ba-23a3f39188cd.png)

data.title: Page not found after clicking the Edit button for doc
data.body:
- Browser: Chrome

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Login to GitHub using account not associated with Microsoft/vscode
2. Go to https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/languages/identifiers
3. Click the `Edit` button

Failure:
Got 404 for the page: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-docs/blob/master/docs/languages/identifiers.md

data.title: Keybinding editor: Consider to make table sortable by Keybinding (and not only by Command)
data.body:
testing #23287:

If I want to find a "free" keybinding, it would be helpful if I could sort the table by the Keybinding. Then I could easily spot the "Cmd+<key>" that is not used.

data.title: Can't run tasks on Git-Bash integrated terminal on Windows
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.11.0-insider (c995ecf2e94a00aa7eda81ed842e787b999e83ae, 2017-03-27T06:11:09.027Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-file-peek|abierbaum|1.0.1|
|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.1.0|
|project-manager|alefragnani|0.13.5|
|quitcontrol-vscode|artdiniz|2.0.2|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.2.0|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|tslint|eg2|0.8.1|
|RunOnSave|emeraldwalk|0.0.16|
|beautify|HookyQR|1.0.2|
|vscode-less|mrmlnc|0.6.2|
|typescript-javascript-grammar|ms-vscode|0.0.18|
|peep|nwallace|0.0.5|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.13|
|better-merge|pprice|0.5.1|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.4.0|
|vscode-nginx|shanoor|0.3.1|
|JasmineSnippets|xabikos|0.2.1|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set Git-Bash as the integrated terminal:

```json
    "terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "C:\\Program Files\\Git\\bin\\bash.exe",
    "terminal.integrated.fontLigatures": true,

```

2. Define a task using tasks version 2.0.0:

```json
{
    // See https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=733558
    // for the documentation about the tasks.json format
    "version": "2.0.0",
    "command": "node",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "args": [
        "node_modules\\typescript\\bin\\tsc",
        "-w",
        "-p",
        "./src/tsconfig.json"
    ],
    "showOutput": "silent",
    "problemMatcher": "$tsc"
}

```

3. Execute run task

Terminal displays:

```
/usr/bin/bash: Files\Git\bin\bash.exe: No such file or directory
Press any key to close the terminal
```

data.title: Keybinding editor: selected item is misleading
data.body:
testing #23287

- VSCode Version: Insiders
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. select a keybinding (edit button appears)
2. move mouse to another item without selecting the item (a second edit button appears)
3. click on the edit button of that item

Observe: The key combination widget appears and the keybinding from step 1. remains the only selected. This is confusing because you are in fact editing the keybinding from step 2 (which is not highlighted in any way).

data.title: Extension host debug: reload window closes the debuggee
data.body:
1. Start debugging a vscode extension
2. Reload the vscode window that just opened (which has the extension running)
3. The window closes instead of reloading

Assigning first to @weinand though it is probably related in how we handle reloads on vscode side by @isidorn and @bpasero

data.title: Consider to ignore casing when sorting keybindings

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
testing #23287:

Currently keybindings without an action name are sorted by their command ID. Since action names are capitalised whereas command IDs are not, and since the sorting takes casing into account, semantically related bindings appear in different location in the list.

Example: all debug commands (starting with the prefix "Debug:") are not grouped together with the debug commands (starting with "debug.").

I suggest that we ignore the casing when sorting keybindings.

data.title: Exception peek widget not showing for throw "Hello World"
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- Tests: #23013 
- VSCode Version: 1.11.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

```ts
class HelloWorld {
    public static main(): number {
        console.log('Hello World');
		throw "Hello WOrld";
        return 0;
    }
}

HelloWorld.main();
```

- debug as node app. 

Observe: exception widget is not showing. 

It does if I throw new Error ('Hello World')

data.title: Test Tour: Vue
data.body:
[Test Tours/Exploratory Testing](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj620911(v=vs.120).aspx#bkmk_tours). We will use a starter kit and use it for a 'GuideBook Tour'. The final goal would be to show a cool demo of how you can use VS Code to do VUE.

You have heard about [Vue](https://vuejs.org/) and you want to try a Vue starter kit https://github.com/cheft/vue-starter-kit with VS Code.

- do you get the extension recommendations?
- set it up for development. 
  - setup debugging
  - setup tasks if applicable
  - setup linting
  - check Intellisense behaviour
- search for Vue extensions in the market place and set them up.
- start implement something fun
- are there additional JSON schemas that should be defined/used to simplify development
- check that all artifacts/file types have syntax coloring
- think of demo of some of the VS Code goodness
